assessments.label: Deadlift
assessments.descriptionHide: A deadlift is a resistance exercise in which you hinge your hips to lift a loaded barbell off the floor.  The 1RM deadlift assessment tests your maximum force production while lifting a loaded barbell off of the floor. This test is to be performed without equipment including belts, straps, or sleeves.
instruction: Stand with the feet at a comfortable width and shins close to the barbell
Grip the barbell with the preferred grip
Lift the barbell by driving the feet into the floor and standing up, pushing the hips forward
Complete the lift by standing up fully, maintaining control of the barbell
Lower the barbell to the ground in a safe and controlled manner

onboarding.prompt: What is your maximum Deadlift for 1 repetition?

rules: Must pause in top position for 1 second

assessments.label: Squat
assessments.descriptionHide: No supportive equipment (Weight lifting belt allowed). Must squat below parallel
instruction: Place bar across upper back and step back into preferred stance
Squat down until thighs are below parallel, hips below knees
Drive feet into the ground and stand up, lifting the barbell
Step forward to re-rack the barbell

onboarding.prompt: What is your maximum Back Squat for 1 repetition?

assessments.label: Bench
assessments.descriptionHide: No supportive equipment. Barbell must make contact with body in bottom position
instruction: Lie on a flat bench with the feet flat on the floor
Grip the barbell with the preferred grip (any width)
Lift barbell off the rack, fully extending the arms
Lower barbell to touch the body
Press barbell back up, extending arms
Carefully re-rack the barbell

onboarding.prompt: What is your maximum Bench Press for 1 repetition?

rules: Barbell must make contact with body in bottom position

assessments.label: Weighted Pull-up
assessments.descriptionHide: No supportive equipment. Weight added below waist. No kipping. Must start in dead-hang position. Must pause in top position for 1 second. Bottom of chin must reach higher than the top of the bar.
instruction: Attach weight to weight belt or vest securely
Stand under pull-up bar, grip bar with preferred grip
From a dead hang position, pull yourself up, chin above bar
Pause briefly at top, then lower yourself back down to starting position

onboarding.prompt: What is your maximum Weighted Pull-up for 1 repetition?

rules: Must pause in top position for 1 second
Bottom of chin must reach higher than the top of the bar

assessments.label: Pushups
assessments.descriptionHide: No stopping movement at any point once the test has begun. Top of elbows must be higher than top of the shoulders in bottom position. Arms must straighten in top position.
instruction: Get into a plank position on your hands and toes, with hands at any preferred width
Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows to 90 degrees or less
Push back up to starting position by extending your arms
Repeat for as many reps as possible with proper form and without pausing at any point
Record the number of reps completed

onboarding.prompt: How many Pushups can you do?

rules: No stopping movement at any point once the test has begun
Top of elbows must be higher than top of the shoulders in bottom position
Arms must straighten in top position

assessments.label: Pullups
assessments.descriptionHide: No stopping movement at any point once the test has begun. Arms must straighten in bottom position. Bottom of chin must reach higher than the top of the bar. No kipping.
instruction: Grip the pull-up bar with any grip
Pull yourself up towards the bar, bringing your chin above the bar
Lower yourself back down without pausing, returning to a dead hang position with fully extended arms
Repeat for as many reps as possible with proper form and without pausing at any point
Record the number of reps completed

onboarding.prompt: How many Pull-ups can you do?

rules: No stopping movement at any point once the test has begun
Arms must straighten in bottom position
Bottom of chin must reach higher than the top of the bar

assessments.label: Squats
assessments.descriptionHide: No stopping movement at any point once the test has begun. Top of thighs must be below top of knees in bottom position. Knees must straighten in top position.
instruction: Load the barbell with half of your bodyweight or more
Position the barbell on your upper back
Squat down until thighs are below parallel, hips below knees
Push back up to the starting position
Repeat for as many reps as possible with proper form and without pausing at any point

onboarding.prompt: How many Back Squats with 100lbs can you do?

rules: No stopping movement at any point once the test has begun
Top of thighs must be below top of knees in bottom position
Knees must straighten in top position

assessments.label: Long Jump
instruction: Stand with feet in any stance behind a clear line
Jump forward
Land with both feet in tandem
Measure distance from the starting point to whichever heel is furthest back

onboarding.prompt: How far can you Standing Long Jump?

rules: Heel that is furthest back is measured

assessments.label: Push Press
instruction: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height with an overhand grip
Dip down and drive the barbell overhead by extending legs and pressing the barbell until arms are fully extended
Record your successful push press 1RM weight lifted for one rep

onboarding.prompt: What is your maximum Push Press for 1 repetition?

assessments.label: 100 meter sprint
instruction: Find a flat and clear area for sprinting and mark start/finish lines
Stand behind the starting line
Sprint as fast as you can towards finish line
Record your time once you cross finish line

onboarding.prompt: How long does it take you to sprint 100 meters?

assessments.label: Clean
instruction: Stand with feet at your preferred stance width in front of a loaded barbell on the floor
Grip the bar and lift by extending hips and knees, shrugging shoulders, and pulling the bar towards the chest
Rotate elbows around and catch the bar on front shoulders in a front squat position
Stand up from front squat position to complete the clean
Record weight lifted for one rep as your clean 1RM test result

onboarding.prompt: What is your maximum Clean for 1 repetition?

assessments.label: Pike
instruction: Position must be held for a minimum of 10 seconds while maintaining proper form
Must be able to perform the test on both sides for balanced results

onboarding.prompt: Use the checklist to assess your Pike Flexibility

rules: Position must be held for 30 seconds

assessments.label: Backbend
instruction: Position must be held for a minimum of 10 seconds while maintaining proper form.

onboarding.prompt: Use the checklist to assess your Backbend Flexibility

rules: Position must be held for 5 seconds

assessments.label: Straddle
assessments.descriptionHide: Position must be held for 5 seconds
instruction: Sit or slide down into a straddle position with legs spread wide apart.
Measure and record the maximum straddle angle.
Hold the position for a few seconds for an accurate measurement.
Use the recorded angle to track progress.

onboarding.prompt: What is the angle of your Straddle?

rules: Position must be held for 5 seconds

assessments.label: 1 Hour Run
instruction: Choose a safe and familiar route for running
Start the clock and run at your desired pace for the full hour
Stay hydrated and take quick breaks if needed, but keep the time running
When the hour is up, stop the clock and record the distance covered

onboarding.prompt: How far can you run in 1 hour?

assessments.label: 2 Minute Sprint
instruction: Choose a safe and familiar flat route for running
Start the clock and run at your desired pace for 2 minutes
Try to maintain a consistent pace and avoid stopping
When 2 minutes are up, stop the clock and record the distance covered

onboarding.prompt: How far can you run in 2 minutes?

assessments.label: Half Spider Web
assessments.description:
Layout of Cones:
 - Home Cone: Center
 - West Cone: 13.5 ft to the left of Home Cone
 - East Cone: 13.5 ft to the right of Home Cone
 - Northwest Cone: 21 ft in front of West Cone
 - North Cone: 21 ft in front of Home Cone
 - Northeast Cone: 21 ft in front of East Cone
instruction: Start at Home Cone.
Side shuffle to West Cone and back.
Sprint to Northwest Cone and back.
Sprint to North Cone and back.
Sprint to Northeast Cone and back.
Side shuffle to East Cone and back.
Time stops when you touch Home Cone after completing the sequence.

onboarding.prompt: How quickly can you perform the half spider web agility test?

rules: Order of cones/markers must be followed
Feet cannot cross while side shuffling

assessments.label: Balance Positions
instruction: Follow the instructions provided for each position
Check off each position you were able to successfully hold for the required time

onboarding.prompt: Use the checklist to assess your Balance

assessments.label: Coordination Skills
instruction: Follow the instructions provided for each skill
Try to perform each coordination skill to the best of your ability
Check off each skill you were able to successfully perform

onboarding.prompt: Use the checklist to assess your Coordination

skills.label: Stick on Finger Palm Up Blind
Opposite center of forearm to toe
Cobra
skills.description: Upper body extended, chest lifted off the ground, arms supporting the upper body

skills.label: Modified Bridge
skills.description: Bridge with feet elevated to knee height (hips lifted off the ground, knees bent, feet elevated to knee height)

skills.label: Bridge
skills.description: Hips lifted off the ground, knees bent, feet flat on the ground

skills.label: Elbow bridge
skills.description: Elbow bridge (similar to bridge, but resting on forearms instead of hands)

skills.label: Knee bridge
skills.description: Knee bridge (hips lifted off the ground, knees bent, only heels touching the ground)

skills.label: Elbow + knee bridge
skills.description: Elbow + knee bridge (combination of elbow bridge and knee bridge)

skills.label: Extended bridge
skills.description: Extended bridge (hips lifted off the ground, knees straight, feet flat on the ground)

skills.label: Grab ankles while in elbow bridge
skills.description: Grab ankles while in elbow bridge (holding onto ankles with hands in elbow bridge position)

skills.label: Chin stand while grabbing ankles
skills.description: Chin stand while grabbing ankles (advanced position where chin touches the ground while grabbing ankles)
